channel.title: Uh help with tables. please
channel.description:
(7TH GRADE MATH)
Complete the function table
Rule: N = W + 9 ------------------------ |Input| P|47|52|57|62|67|72|77 |output|J| ----------------------
This paper dident come with instructions So i decided to post for help here basically what i need to know is how to find the output and that's the best way i can explain it..

item.title: Uh help with tables. please
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Jc22493:

You’re doing math as simple as that in 7th grade?

Yes he is, obviously, since you asked the question.

Just to make it clear although this is very simple, the Output (O) is gathered or derived from the Input (I) according to the rule given. For example:

Rule: O = I + 15 - 10

I = 12, 22, 27, 32, 42
O = 17, 27, 32, 37, 47 ~ The Output is gathered or derived from adding 15 and taking away 10 from the Input.

Read full topic

item.title: Uh help with tables. please
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

What does N and W stand for? Would it be Output = input + 9? / Input = output + 9

If it’s that than it must be simple. The only thing that somewhat stumps me is output j = input p

The sheet must supply you with what the variables stand for or it’d be one hell of a problem for a seventh grader

[inb4underageb&]
